name: Theodore Roosevelt National Park
description: When Theodore Roosevelt came to Dakota Territory to hunt bison in 1883, he was a skinny, young, spectacled dude from New York. He could not have imagined how his adventure in this remote and unfamiliar place would forever alter the course of the nation. The rugged landscape and strenuous life that TR experienced here would help shape a conservation policy that we still benefit from today.
shortDescription: When Theodore Roosevelt came to Dakota Territory to hunt bison in 1883, he was a skinny, young, spectacled dude from New York. He could not have imagined how his adventure in this remote and unfamilia...

operatingHours.description: Theodore Roosevelt National Park is open 24 hours a day, every day of the year. This applies to all units of the park; North Unit, South Unit, and Elkhorn Ranch Unit. Even when entrance stations and visitor centers are closed, the park itself remains open. Remember to check current conditions for any weather related closures.

fees.title: Entrance - Private Vehicle
fees.description: Valid for 7 days for all persons traveling in a single, private, non-commercial vehicle.

fees.title: Entrance - Motorcycle
fees.description: Valid for 7 days. Admits up to 2 private, non-commercial motorcycles with up to 4 total passengers.

fees.title: Entrance - Per Person
fees.description: Valid for 7 days for a visitor traveling on foot, bicycle, horse, or other non-motorized means of travel.

fees.title: Commercial Entrance - Van
fees.description: Based upon the total capacity of a vehicle that can carry 7-15 passengers, regardless of the actual number of passengers. A commercial tour is defined as consisting of one or more persons traveling on an itinerary that has been packaged, priced, or sold for leisure or recreational purposes by an organization that realizes financial gain through the provision of the service. Pass is good for seven days as long as it's the same passenger group.

fees.title: Commercial Entrance - Mini-bus
fees.description: Based upon the total capacity of a vehicle that can carry 16-25 passengers, regardless of the actual number of passengers. A commercial tour is defined as consisting of one or more persons traveling on an itinerary that has been packaged, priced, or sold for leisure or recreational purposes by an organization that realizes financial gain through the provision of the service. Pass is good for seven days as long as it's the same passenger group.

fees.title: Commercial Entrance - Motor Coach
fees.description: Based upon the total capacity of a vehicle that can carry 26 or more passengers, regardless of the actual number of passengers. A commercial tour is defined as consisting of one or more persons traveling on an itinerary that has been packaged, priced, or sold for leisure or recreational purposes by an organization that realizes financial gain through the provision of the service. Pass is good for seven days as long as it's the same passenger group.

climate.weatherDescription: In winter, some or all park roads may be closed due to snow.

images.title: River Bend Overlook, North Unit
images.altText: A colorfully striped butte in the foreground overlooks a dark green badlands landscape
images.caption: The River Bend Overlook offers one of the most popular views in the park's North Unit.

images.title: A View from the Maah Daah Hey Trail
images.altText: the Little Missouri River under blue skies
images.caption: The Maah Daah Hey Trail follows the Little Missouri River for several miles before it enters the Theodore Roosevelt Wilderness.

images.title: Ekblom Trail
images.altText: A muddy river bank lined with cottonwood trees and steep buttes
images.caption: The Ekblom Trail is the gateway to the Theodore Roosevelt Wilderness. All you have to do is make it across the river!

images.title: Raise a Ruckus
images.altText: two bull bison collide heads in a dusty battle for dominance
images.caption: In the summer, bull bison wage furious battles over the right to breed.

images.title: Milky Way
images.altText: the swirling, dusty looking milky way runs vertically though a starry night sky
images.caption: Though light pollution in the area is increasing, the night sky over Theodore Roosevelt National Park remains beautiful and inspiring.

images.title: Bison Trail
images.altText: a string of bison are silhouetted against the backdrop of hazy blue and yellow badlands
images.caption: Bison roam the badlands from top to bottom, surprising visitors with their agility and ability to cross even the most rugged terrain.
images.credit: NPS Photo / Roland and Lisa Honeyman

images.title: Sunset on Buck Hill
images.altText: a green prairie hilltop overlooks the badlands, shrouded in shadows
images.caption: A short climb to the top of Buck Hill in the park's South Unit rewards hikers with a sweeping panorama and a fantastic place to watch the sun rise or set.

images.title: Fall Bugle
images.altText: A bugling bull elk and his harem of cows stand on the edge of a butte as the sunlight fades
images.caption: The ghostly bugles of bull elk can be heard wafting through the badlands in the fall.
images.credit: NPS Photo / Rolan and Lisa Honeyman

images.title: Hoodoos
images.altText: a strange looking sand and rock formation stands in a prairie of brown grass
images.caption: Theodore Roosevelt described the badlands as "so fantastically broken in form and so bizarre in color as to seem hardly properly to belong to this earth."

images.title: Maltese Cross Cabin
images.altText: The rising sun casts light on Roosevelt's snow-covered cabin.
images.caption: Imagine waking up on a crisp winter morning in Roosevelt's Maltese Cross Cabin. It is no wonder that his heart was captured by the romance of life in the West.
